headline: The VC Firm Backing 'Absurd' Startups
summary: Long Journey Ventures says it sets out to back founders with ideas that seem absurd but will eventually become mainstream. Two of the VC firm's co-founders, Lee Jacobs and Cyan Banister, join Caroline Hyde on "Bloomberg Technology".

raw.headline: The VC Firm Backing 'Absurd' Startups
raw.summary: Long Journey Ventures says it sets out to back founders with ideas that seem absurd but will eventually become mainstream. Two of the VC firm's co-founders, Lee Jacobs and Cyan Banister, join Caroline Hyde on "Bloomberg Technology".

headline: Something is seriously off about advertisements for AI products
summary: In their attempts to make their billions of dollars of investment worth it, tech companies appear to have lost their sense of seriousness and touch with reality.

raw.headline: Something is seriously off about advertisements for AI products
raw.summary: In their attempts to make their billions of dollars of investment worth it, tech companies appear to have lost their sense of seriousness and touch with reality.

headline: Uber Technologies (NYSE:UBER) Partners With Petco For Seamless Pet Supplies Delivery
summary: Uber Technologies (NYSE:UBER) recently announced a partnership with Petco, expanding Uber Eats to include more than 15,000 pet care products, and offering promotions for both new and existing users. Such expansion into retail aligns with Uber's strategy to diversify its offerings, also marked by similar collaborations with Sally Beauty and FreshDirect. Despite broader market pressures due to inflation concerns, the company's agile responses likely supported its stock price increase of 22%...

headline: Market-Beating Tech Stocks to Buy Amid AI Downturn: UBER, SPOT
summary: Uber and Spotify have crushed tech in 2025 as investors look to non-AI names for growth. Both are also flexing their earnings growth and looking cheap.

raw.headline: Market-Beating Tech Stocks to Buy Amid AI Downturn: UBER, SPOT

headline: Uber, Petco announce new partnership
summary: Uber (UBER) and Petco (WOOF) announced a new partnership that brings Petco’s wide selection of pet essentials to the Uber Eats platform. With all Petco locations in the contiguous United States now available on Uber Eats, customers can shop for on-demand or scheduled delivery of pet food, toys, treats, and other essentials-all at the tap of a button.
